meanings.definition: The arrangement or system of veins in a leaf or other plant structure.
meanings.sent1: The nervature of the leaf helps in transporting nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the nervature of various plant species.
meanings.sent3: The nervature of the leaf looked like a complex road map.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic interpretation of nervature transformed it into a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The nervature of the leaf resembled intricate lacework.

meanings.definition: The network of nerves in an organism.
meanings.sent1: The nervature of the human body is essential for transmitting signals.
meanings.sent2: Doctors examine the nervature to understand neurological conditions.
meanings.sent3: The nervature of the nervous system seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: The nervature of society connects us all in unseen ways.
meanings.sent5: His speech was as tangled as a nervature of wires.
